**Solution**. (A)\
A nice way to see (1) is in the frequency domain. $X_n$ is AR(1) and so has spectruum $\sigma^2_\epsilon/|1-a \exp{i\omega}|^2 = \sigma^2_\epsilon/(1+a^2-2a\cos(\omega))$. $\eta_n$ has spectrum $\sigma^2_\eta$, and so $Y_n$ has spectrum
\begin{eqnarray}
\sigma^2_\eta + \frac{\sigma^2_epsilon}{1+a^2-2a\cos(\omega)}
&=& \frac{\sigma^2_\eta(1+a^2)+\sigma^2_\epsilon - 2a\sigma^2_eta\cos(\omega)}{
1+a^2-2a\cos(\omega)}
\\
&=&
 \sigma^2 \frac{(1+b^2)- 2b\cos(\omega) }{1+a^2-2a\cos(\omega)}
\end{eqnarray}
where $\sigma$ and $b$ solve
\begin{eqnarray}
\sigma^2 (1+b^2) &=& \sigma^2_\eta(1+a^2)+\sigma^2_\epsilon,
\\
\sigma^2 b &=& a\sigma^2_eta
\end{eqnarray}

(2) is the same set of equations as (1), as seen by setting $X_n^\prime = \left(\begin{array}{c} X_n \\ \epsilon_n \end{array}\right)$.

(3) is the ARMA(1,1) case of the LG-POMP representation of a general ARMA model givein in Chapter 11.
Specifically, set $X_n = \left(\begin{array}{c} Y_n \\ b \epsilon_n \end{array}\right)$, and see that the process model becomes
\begin{equation}\nonumber
\left(\begin{array}{c} Y_n \\ b \epsilon_n \end{array}\right)
=
\left(\begin{array}{c} a Y_{n-1} + b\epsilon_{n-1} + \epsilon_n \\ b \epsilon_n \end{array}\right).
\end{equation}
